name.description: The name of the render graph.

comment.description: Put author information, links, etc here.

version.description: The gigi version of the render graph.

variables.description: The render graph variables. Used for getting parameters from the host app and user. Can be referenced by many things in the render graph such as texture size and shader constants.

Const.description: If true, the variable is declared const and cannot change at runtime

Static.description: If true, the variable has the same value for all instances of the technique

dflt.description: The default value of the variable. The default memory is zero initialized before this is parsed, so if you don't give it enough initializers, it will use zero for the unlisted fields.

visibility.description: Who can see and interact with this variable

Enum.description: Integer types can specify an enum, which will then make symbols in both C++ and shader code.

backends.description: This variable can be limited to specific backends
A list of backends supported. Empty list means all backends

isWhiteList.description: If true, this is a list of allowed platforms. if false, it's a list of disallowed platforms.

transient.description: If true, the variable should not be saved between runs of this technique. The Gigi viewer uses this to decide if it should save it in the gguser file or not, for example.

min.description: The minimum value of the variable. Leave blank for no minimum.

max.description: The maximum value of the variable. Leave blank for no maximum.

step.description: The step size of the variable. Leave blank for default step size.

UIGroup.description: Used to organize variables into folders in the viewer. separate folders with dots.  For instance: settings.controls

shaders.description: The shaders used by the render graph.

name.description: The name of the shader, as it will be referenced by nodes

fileName.description: The file name of the shader file.

type.description: The type of shader it is

defines.description: The defines the shader is compiled with.

CSNumThreads.description: For compute shaders only, the number of threads each dispatch has. 61,1,1 suggested for 1d. 8,8,1 for 2d. 4,4,4 for 3d.

NumThreads.description: The number of threads each dispatch has, for applicable shader types. 64,1,1 suggested for 1d. 8,8,1 for 2d. 4,4,4 for 3d.

copyFile.description: if false, will not copy the file over. A hackaround for when you have multiple raytracing shaders in the same file. TODO: resolve this better.

slangOptions.description: Settings for optionally processing shaders with slang

process.description: if true, this shader will be processed by slang
